Posts.Content: Oct 29, 2008 09:17PM KiminNewOrleansLA wrote: Thank you all for your comments and advice.  I am going to make the appointment...to ease hubbys mind as well as my kids! I'll post my results for ya'll to be able to follow up on...those who are interested! Hugs, Kim
Posts.Title: I'm not actually worried, but I need some opinions KiminNewOrleansLA pk0199

Posts.Content: Nov 7, 2008 08:04PM KiminNewOrleansLA wrote: Hi everyone!  I have great news!  I had my diagnostic mammogram and ultrasound today and all they found was tons of benign cysts.  Woo hoo.  AND it didn't hurt as bad as the first one.  I forgot to take Motrin as I planned, but they had new equipment and didn't have to smash quite as flat as before! lol Thank you all again for your thoughts and prayers.  It means a lot to me to know you all do care! Hugs, Kim
Posts.Title: I'm not actually worried, but I need some opinions KiminNewOrleansLA pk0199

Posts.Content: Oct 30, 2008 09:58AM KiminNewOrleansLA wrote: Penny, thank you for your prayers and insight from the other side.  I will definitely take Motrin before I go and since I'm not a coffee drinker and don't take caffeine in from other sources, that won't be an issue.  (very weird that caffeine can affect pain!)  When I went in for the 1st mammogram, I was so brave! (I told myself that the first time I ever got one was a fluke that it hurt so badly and surely now, 7 years later it wouldn't hurt so much-I was dead wrong!)  Now, I'm telling myself that it may hurt, but it only lasts for a short time and then goes away.  I also found out that my doctors office has new equipment and shouldn't hurt the same way.  Making my appointment as I type!  Have a great day!
Posts.Title: I'm not actually worried, but I need some opinions KiminNewOrleansLA pk0199
